wizard.name: Call Java code from Epsilon
wizard.description: In this example, we create a JFrame from EOL. The aim of this example is to show how to call Java code from within Epsilon languages.

wizard.name: Creating custom Java tools for Epsilon
wizard.description: In this example, we create a custom tool for Epsilon.

wizard.name: Building and querying plain XML documents with EOL
wizard.description: In this example, we use the plain XML driver of Epsilon to build and query an XML document that is not backed by a XSD/DTD.

wizard.name: Generating HTML pages from an XML document
wizard.description: In this example, we use the plain XML driver of Epsilon in the context of an EGL model-to-text transformation.

wizard.name: Cloning and copying XML elements across documents with EOL
wizard.description: In this example, we use the plain XML driver of Epsilon to clone and copy XML elements across different documents with EOL.

wizard.name: Cloning EMF model elements with EOL
wizard.description: In this example, we demonstrate how the EmfTool built-in tool can be used to perform deep-copy (cloning) of EMF model elements using EOL.

wizard.name: Profiling and caching in EOL
wizard.description: This example demonstrates the caching capabilities and the profiling tools provided by Epsilon.

wizard.name: MDD-TIF complete case study
wizard.description: In this example, we demonstrate how different languages in Epsilon (EVL, EGL, EML, ETL and ECL) can be combined to implement more complex operations.

wizard.name: Compare, validate and merge OO models
wizard.description: In this example, we use ECL to compare two OO models, then use EVL to check the identified matches for consistency and finally EML to merge them.

wizard.name: Implement a GMF editor with image nodes using EuGENia
wizard.description: In this example we use EuGENia to implement a GMF editor with images instead of shapes for nodes.

wizard.name: Implement a GMF editor with end labels in connections using EuGENia
wizard.description: In this example we use EuGENia to implement a GMF editor with end labels in connections.

wizard.name: Implement a flowchart GMF editor using EuGENia
wizard.description: In this example we use EuGENia to implement a flowchart GMF editor, and EOL to polish its appearance.

wizard.name: Provide custom/extended tasks for the workflow
wizard.description: In this example we demonstrate how you can define your own ANT tasks that extend the Epsilon workflow tasks.

wizard.name: Migrate Petri net models with Epsilon Flock
wizard.description: In this example we demonstrate how to migrate a model in response to metamodel changes with Epsilon Flock.

wizard.name: Use model transactions in a workflow
wizard.description: In this example we demonstrate using the ant-contrib try/catch tasks and the Epsilon model transactions tasks to conditionally rollback changes in models modified in a workflow.

wizard.name: Manage XSD-backed XML files with EOL
wizard.description: In this example we demonstrate using EOL to query an XSD-backed XML file.

wizard.name: Test EOL scripts with EUnit
wizard.description: In this example we show the basic structure of an EUnit test, some useful assertions for the basic types and how to test for errors and define our own assertions.

wizard.name: Reuse EUnit tests with model and data bindings
wizard.description: In this example we show how the same EUnit test can be reused for several models, and how EUnit supports several levels of parametric tests.

wizard.name: Test a model validation script with EUnit
wizard.description: In this example we show how a model validation script written in EVL can be tested with EUnit, using the exportAsModel attribute of the EVL workflow task.

wizard.name: Test a model-to-text transformation with EUnit
wizard.description: In this example we show how a model-to-text transformation written in EGL can be tested with EUnit and HUTN.

wizard.name: Integrate EUnit into a standard JUnit plug-in test
wizard.description: In this example we show how to write an EUnit/JUnit plug-in test of an ETL transformation.
